name: HIP 8541
scenarioDescription:
The HIP 8541 Exoplanetary System

HIP 8541 is a star with 1.17 times the mass of the Sun, and 7.83 times its radius. It is located 550.00 light years away from the solar system.

HIP 8541 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

HIP 8541 b

HIP 8541 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.80 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 1560.20 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, HIP 8541.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.16, which means that when HIP 8541 b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 2.35 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 3.25. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of HIP 8541 b is 1747.96 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HIP 8541 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HIP 8541, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Multiple Observatories.
